Art. 4.140. Tutor
A minor who has reached the age of sixteen years may not, even by will, dispose of property in favour of his tutor.
 A minor who has reached the age of majority may not dispose of property, either by gift or by will, in favour of the person who was his tutor, unless the final account of the tutorship has first been rendered and cleared.
In the cases provided for in paragraphs 1 and 2 above, ascendants of minors who are or have been their tutors are excepted.
